page.title: 04BISLEY BLUECOAT SCHOOL
page.content: The school has eighty pupil from the village and surrounding hamlets. The children are aged from four to eleven after which time they transfer to Secondary school at Eastcombe or Stroud under a select system. The School as four teachers, one of whom is part-time. Dinners are cooked on the premises. The School built in 1854, is a continuation of the Blue Coat School of earlier times (1662?). The charity worsted blue coat was only abandoned during the First World War. In addition is has an "Elliott" hall and a terrapin classroom. It has outside toilets for the children and the staff. The school stands next to the church and has a playground which is also used for wedding and funeral processions. It has an area of grass with a wooden climbing-frame and it is all surrounded by drystone walling.
